info.abstract:
(introduction - contributed documentation for ISI PL) (NB development and distribution of PL at USC ISI) (NB PL implementations in Common Lisp, C++, Java and - with further contributed code - .. refer to PL homepage.)
(references the OKBC and earlier GFP initiatives - SRI AIC et al. Make expanded reference in main text, with bibliographical references there. See also, Stanford KSL, and - at USC ISI - LOOM(r) and &pl; release notes, LOOM(r) and &pl; published articles)
Note that PL develops a manner of a KIF-like syntax, in PLI and - more generally - STELLA eource forms. (TBD: Origins, proposed standards for KIF as approximately a category of knowledge representation notations sharing a common syntax and semantics. Note the earlier KL-ONE[KL-ONE] and ACTOR systems [Hewitt]. Note other notational systems in knowledge representation - IDP [DTAI]; Prolog [KSL]; DAML, DAML+OIL (TBD) and subsq RDF, OWL; Common Logic [RiceU]; cf. OKBC, ODM [OMG] (individual ODM metamodels, and ODM profiles onto the UML metamodel). Try to include reference to FIPA [ISO?], as may pertainin to any approaches for knowledge sharing across distributed systems. Note, then, PL SOAP (and thus, SDBC) systems.
[DTAI] https://dtai.cs.kuleuven.be/software/idp
[KL-ONE] cf. articles, note the "Original KL-ONE initiative" pedagogically, and subsq. developments published at the CMU AI Repository http://www.cs.cmu.edu/afs/cs/project/ai-repository/ai/areas/kr/systems/kl_one/0.html
[Hewitt]
[TBD] DAML, DAML+OIL [W3C] RDF, OWL
[KSL] Prolog, Epilog, ...
[RiceU, ISO] Common Logic - articles, WG proceedings
[OMG] MOF, XMI, UML, UML-DI, ODM
[FIPA] TBD
Note RDF in extension - highlighting LoC and GVP initiatives, if not also RDF in Netscape/Firefox XUL, RDF in DOAP vocab, etc. @ software/syatems,
Editor's Note: This documentation has been contributed for &pl; in an effort to aid in further development of software systems, such that may be derived from &pl; or may make reference to &pl;. This is not to replace — though it is hoped that it may serve to augment — the original &pl; manual and &pl; source code.
NB Availability - source code, and public fork - address, to detail, in preface
NB Marks of trade - ensure statements are published in frontmatter
